definition: to give a nod of approval
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
old variant of 肯[ken3]
to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing

sentences.english: I'm hprair coolingticwouls applicationy that 'Masche' has joined us for two reasons.
sentences.chinese: 马切的加盟让我很首肯，有两个情由。

sentences.english: Mr. Pickwick, who had been deeply investigating the interior of the pigeon-pie, readily assented.
sentences.chinese: 深深地钻研着鸽子饼内幕的匹克威克先生欣然首肯了。

sentences.english: China could not have joined the IADB without US consent.
sentences.chinese: 没有美国的首肯，中国也不可能加入泛美开发银行。

sentences.english: The absurd man says yes and his effort will henceforth be unceasing.
sentences.chinese: 荒谬的人对此必会首肯，他的努力将夙夜匪懈。

sentences.english: Our professional products and service have wined the belaudings of customers.
sentences.chinese: 专业的产品和服务得到行业内广大知名客商的首肯。

definition: to give one's assent/to consent
to promise/to consent (to do sth)
to inspire/to incite
to accept tacitly/acquiescence
to ask for instructions
to persuade
clapper-board/auctioneer's hammer/to beat time with clappers
in a way that justifies the use of the term/genuine/proper/in a way that conforms to logic/justifiable/appropriate/perfectly legitimate
to appreciate/to recognize the worth of sth/appreciation
this is no small thing (idiom)/to have a serious matter at hand
to receive sb/to grant an interview
to set out (on a campaign)/to stand for election/to throw one's cap in the ring
prevail/convince
to make a decision/to determine
to solicit/to seek/to request (opinions, feedback etc)/to petition
to persuade/to convince/to talk sb over/Taiwan pr. [shui4 fu2]
